Type.Name: TreeStore

TypeSignature.Value: public class TreeStore : GLib.Object, TreeModel, IWrapper, TreeDragSource, TreeDragDest, TreeSortable, IWrapper, IDisposable

Type.ThreadSafetyStatement: Gtk# is thread aware, but not thread safe; See the Gtk# Thread Programming for details.

Docs.summary: A tree-like data structure that can be used with the
Docs.remarks: The object is a list model for use with a widget. It implements the interface, and consequentialy, can use all of the methods available there. It also implements the interface so it can be sorted by the view. Finally, it also implements the tree drag and drop interfaces.

MemberSignature.Value: public virtual int IterNChildren ();

Docs.summary: Returns the number of children that the has.
Docs.remarks: As a special case, if iter is , then the number of toplevel nodes is returned.

MemberSignature.Value: public virtual bool IterChildren (out Gtk.TreeIter iter);

Docs.summary: Sets the TreeIter object pointed to by the iter param to point to the first child of this tree.

MemberSignature.Value: public void Prepend (out Gtk.TreeIter iter);

Docs.summary: Prepends a new row to the .
Docs.remarks: It will prepend a row to the top level. will be changed to point to this new row. The row will be empty after this method is called. To fill in values, you need to call .

MemberSignature.Value: public void Append (out Gtk.TreeIter iter);

Docs.summary: Appends a new row to the .

remarks.para: It will append a row to the top level. will be changed to point to this new row. The row will be empty after this method is called. To fill in values, you need to call .

MemberSignature.Value: public virtual void ChangeSortColumn ();

Docs.summary: Fires a event.
Docs.remarks: Designed to be called by routines that change the sort of the tree.

MemberSignature.Value: public virtual void SetSortColumnId (int sort_column_id, Gtk.SortType order);

Docs.summary: Sets which column is to be used to sort the data in the tree.
Docs.param: A , the kind of sort to use

MemberSignature.Value: public virtual void SetSortFunc (int sort_column_id, Gtk.TreeIterCompareFunc sort_func, IntPtr user_data, Gtk.DestroyNotify destroy);

Docs.summary: Sets a function that should be used to be sort a particular column.
Docs.param: A , the index of the column to be sorted
A , the function to use for sorting
Docs.remarks: This overload is obsolete. The two parameter is preferred for new code.

MemberSignature.Value: public virtual void SetDefaultSortFunc (Gtk.TreeIterCompareFunc sort_func, IntPtr user_data, Gtk.DestroyNotify destroy);

Docs.summary: Sets a function that should be used to be sort columns by default if not otherwise specified by .
Docs.param: A , the function to use for sorting
Docs.remarks: This overload is obsolete. The single parameter overload is preferred for new code.

MemberSignature.Value: public virtual bool RowDropPossible (Gtk.TreePath dest_path, Gtk.SelectionData selection_data);

Docs.summary: Tests whether can be dropped on .
Docs.param: a , potential data to be dropped.
Docs.returns: a , true if drop is allowed

MemberSignature.Value: public virtual bool DragDataReceived (Gtk.TreePath dest, Gtk.SelectionData selection_data);

Docs.summary: Drags data received into this object.
Docs.param: A , the destination path of the drag
A , the data that was dragged
Docs.returns: A boolean, true if the data was successfully received.

MemberSignature.Value: public virtual bool DragDataGet (Gtk.TreePath path, Gtk.SelectionData selection_data);

Docs.summary: Method used when this TreeStore is part of a source widget for a drag-and-drop operation; gets the data that was dragged from the associated widget.
Docs.returns: A , true if the operation succeeded.

MemberSignature.Value: public virtual bool RowDraggable (Gtk.TreePath path);

Docs.summary: Returns whether or not a given row can be dragged.
Docs.returns: A boolean, true if the row is draggable.

MemberSignature.Value: public virtual bool DragDataDelete (Gtk.TreePath path);

Docs.summary: When this TreeStore is the data source for a drag operation and the drag operation is a move, this method runs to delete the data after the data has been received by the target widget.
Docs.param: A , the path of the data to delete.
Docs.returns: A , true if the operation succeeds.

MemberSignature.Value: public virtual void EmitRowChanged (Gtk.TreePath path, Gtk.TreeIter iter);

Docs.summary: Emits the event.

MemberSignature.Value: public virtual void Foreach (Gtk.TreeModelForeachFunc func);

Docs.summary: Calls on each node in model in a depth-first fashion.
Docs.remarks: If func returns , then the tree ceases to be walked, and this method returns.

MemberSignature.Value: public virtual bool GetIterFirst (out Gtk.TreeIter iter);

Docs.summary: Gets the first iterator in the tree (the one at the path "0") and returns .
Docs.remarks: Returns if the tree is empty.

MemberSignature.Value: public virtual void EmitRowHasChildToggled (Gtk.TreePath path, Gtk.TreeIter iter);

Docs.summary: Emits the event.

MemberSignature.Value: public virtual Gtk.TreePath GetPath (Gtk.TreeIter iter);

Docs.summary: Gets the of .

MemberSignature.Value: public virtual bool IterHasChild (Gtk.TreeIter iter);

Docs.summary: Returns if iter has children, otherwise.

MemberSignature.Value: public virtual void RefNode (Gtk.TreeIter iter);

Docs.summary: Lets the tree ref the node.

remarks.para: This is an optional method for models to implement. To be more specific, models may ignore this call as it exists primarily for performance reasons.

This function is primarily meant as a way for views to let caching model know when nodes are being displayed (and hence, whether or not to cache that node.) For example, a file-system based model would not want to keep the entire file-hierarchy in memory, just the sections that are currently being displayed by every current view.
A model should be expected to be able to get an iter independent of its referenced state.

MemberSignature.Value: public virtual int IterNChildren (Gtk.TreeIter iter);

Docs.summary: Returns the number of children that has.
Docs.remarks: As a special case, if is , then the number of toplevel nodes is returned.

MemberSignature.Value: public virtual void EmitRowInserted (Gtk.TreePath path, Gtk.TreeIter iter);

Docs.summary: Emits the event.

MemberSignature.Value: public virtual void EmitRowDeleted (Gtk.TreePath path);

Docs.summary: Emits the event.
Docs.remarks: This should be called by models after a row has been removed. The location pointed to by should be the location that the row previously was at. It may not be a valid location anymore.

MemberSignature.Value: public virtual void GetValist (Gtk.TreeIter iter, IntPtr var_args);

Docs.summary: Gets the values of child properties for the row pointed to by .
Docs.param: a , pointer to the va_list data structure of arguments (FIXME: clarify what va_lists look like)

MemberSignature.Value: public virtual void UnrefNode (Gtk.TreeIter iter);

Docs.summary: Lets the tree unref the node.
Docs.remarks: This is an optional method for models to implement. To be more specific, models may ignore this call as it exists primarily for performance reasons. For more information on what this means, see . Please note that nodes that are deleted are not unreferenced.

Docs.summary: Returns if is an ancestor of .
Docs.remarks: That is, is the parent (or grandparent or great-grandparent) of .

MemberSignature.Value: public void SetValue (Gtk.TreeIter iter, int column, GLib.Value value);

Docs.summary: Sets the data in the cell specified by and .
Docs.remarks: The type of value must be convertible to the type of the column.

MemberSignature.Value: public int IterDepth (Gtk.TreeIter iter);

Docs.summary: Returns the depth of .
Docs.remarks: This will be 0 for anything on the root level, 1 for anything down a level, etc.

Docs.summary: Disposes the resources associated with the object.

Docs.summary: Returns the number of columns supported by the .

Docs.summary: Returns a set of flags supported by this .
Docs.remarks: The flags are a bitwise combination of . The flags supported should not change during the lifecycle of the .

Docs.summary: Emitted when the sort column of the has changed.

Docs.summary: Emitted when a child of a row is toggled.

Docs.summary: Emitted when a row is in the is changed.

MemberSignature.Value: public virtual bool IterNthChild (out Gtk.TreeIter iter, int n);

Docs.summary: Sets to be the child of the root node, using the given index.
Docs.remarks: In this case, the nth root node is set.

MemberSignature.Value: public void InsertAfter (out Gtk.TreeIter iter, Gtk.TreeIter sibling);

Docs.summary: Inserts a new row after .

remarks.para: If is , then the row will be prepended to the children of its parent. If parent and sibling are , then the row will be prepended to the toplevel. If both and parent are set, then parent must be the parent of . When is set, parent is optional.

MemberSignature.Value: public void InsertBefore (out Gtk.TreeIter iter, Gtk.TreeIter sibling);

Docs.summary: Inserts a new row before .
Docs.remarks: If is , then the row will be appended to the children of its parent. If parent and sibling are , then the row will be appended to the toplevel. If both and parent are set, then parent must be the parent of . When is set, parent is optional.

MemberSignature.Value: public void Insert (out Gtk.TreeIter iter, int position);

Docs.summary: Creates a new row at .
Docs.remarks: If parent is not , then the row will be made a child of parent. Otherwise, the row will be created at the toplevel. If is larger than the number of rows at that level, then the new row will be inserted to the end of the list. will be changed to point to this new row. The row will be empty after this function is called. To fill in values, you need to call .

MemberSignature.Value: public virtual bool IterNthChild (out Gtk.TreeIter iter, Gtk.TreeIter parent, int n);

Docs.summary: Sets to be the child of , using the given index.
Docs.remarks: The first index is 0. If is too big, or has no children, is set to an invalid iterator and is returned. will remain a valid node after this function has been called.

MemberSignature.Value: public virtual bool GetIterFromString (out Gtk.TreeIter iter, string path_string);

Docs.summary: Gets the at .
Docs.remarks: Otherwise, is left invalid and is returned.

MemberSignature.Value: public virtual bool IterChildren (out Gtk.TreeIter iter, Gtk.TreeIter parent);

Docs.summary: Sets to point to the first child of .
Docs.remarks: If has no children, is returned and is set to be invalid. will remain a valid node after this function has been called.

MemberSignature.Value: public virtual bool GetIter (out Gtk.TreeIter iter, Gtk.TreePath path);

Docs.summary: Sets to a valid iterator pointing to .

MemberSignature.Value: public virtual bool IterParent (out Gtk.TreeIter iter, Gtk.TreeIter child);

Docs.summary: Sets to be the parent of .
Docs.remarks: If is at the toplevel, and does not have a parent, then is set to an invalid iterator and is returned. will remain a valid node after this function has been called.

Docs.summary: Marshals the given into a path string.

MemberSignature.Value: public void MoveAfter (Gtk.TreeIter iter, Gtk.TreeIter position);

Docs.summary: Move the row pointed to by to the position after . If is , will be moved to point to the start of the list.
Docs.remarks: This only works in unsorted stores.

MemberSignature.Value: public void Swap (Gtk.TreeIter a, Gtk.TreeIter b);

Docs.summary: Swaps rows a and b in the store.
Docs.remarks: This is only works in unsorted stores.

MemberSignature.Value: public void MoveBefore (Gtk.TreeIter iter, Gtk.TreeIter position);

Docs.summary: Move the row pointed to by to the position before . If is , will be moved to point to the end of the list.
Docs.remarks: This only works in unsorted stores.

MemberSignature.Value: public bool IterIsValid (Gtk.TreeIter iter);

Docs.summary: Test whether is valid for this TreeStore.
Docs.remarks: WARNING: this method is slow and is only intended for debugging/testing purposes.

example.code: Treestore store; store = new TreeStore (typeof (int), typeof (string));

a , the current type of sort (ascending or descending)
Docs.returns: a , false if the default sort column for this TreeStore is being used, true if some other sort column is being used.

MemberSignature.Value: public bool Remove (ref Gtk.TreeIter iter);

Docs.summary: Removes a row from the store.
Docs.remarks: After being removed, is set to be the next valid row, or invalidated if it pointed to the last row in the store.

Docs.summary: Reorders the TreeStore.

MemberSignature.Value: public Gtk.TreeIter Insert (Gtk.TreeIter parent, int position);

Docs.summary: Inserts a new row at position .
Docs.returns: a pointing to the new row.
Docs.remarks: If is larger than the number of rows on the list, then the new row will be appended to the list. The row will be empty before this function is called. To set the value of the new row, use .

Docs.remarks: The row will be empty before this function is called. To set the value of the new row, use .
